sub_topic: Finding the inverse of a matrix
message_1: If A is a 3x3 matrix with determinant equal to 5, find the inverse of the matrix A.
message_2:
To find the inverse of a 3x3 matrix A, we need to follow these steps:

1. Find the matrix of minors.
2. Create the matrix of cofactors.
3. Transpose the matrix of cofactors.
4. Divide each element by the determinant of A.

Let A be:

| a b c |
| d e f |
| g h i |

First, we find the matrix of minors:

| (ei - fh) (fi - fc) (ce - fb) |
| (gi - ch) (ai - gc) (ac - gb) |
| (gh - di) (dh - af) (ae - bd) |

Next, we create the matrix of cofactors by applying the checkerboard pattern of positive and negative signs:

| +(ei - fh) -(fi - fc) +(ce - fb) |
| -(gi - ch) +(ai - gc) -(ac - gb) |
| +(gh - di) -(dh - af) +(ae - bd) |

Now, we transpose the matrix of cofactors:

| (ei - fh) (gi - ch) (gh - di) |
| (fc - fi) (ai - gc) (dh - af) |
| (fb - ce) (gb - ac) (ae - bd) |

Finally, we divide each element by the determinant of A, which is 5:

| (ei - fh)/5 (gi - ch)/5 (gh - di)/5 |
| (fc - fi)/5 (ai - gc)/5 (dh - af)/5 |
| (fb - ce)/5 (gb - ac)/5 (ae - bd)/5 |

This is the inverse of matrix A.
